Letters and Positioning

A Perfect Solver for Wordle using Data

Worldle is an interesting, challenging and fun word game. If you aren't familiar with it, I suggest that you play it before reading this article

Step 1 - Raw Materials

The first thing we need is a word list. It turns out that on most unix systems there is a word list that can be found at /usr/share/dict/words. The file has a single word per line, so we've just uploaded the entire files (as a CSV) into BigQuery.

explore: words is table('malloy-data.malloytest.words'){}

query: words->{project: *}
QUERY RESULTS

SELECT 
   words.word as word
FROM `malloy-data.malloytest.words` as words

We are only interested in 5 letter words so create a query for that and limit the results to 5 letter words.

explore: words is table('malloy-data.malloytest.words'){
  query: five_letter_words is {
    where: length(word) = 5  // add a filter
    project: word
  }
}

query: words->five_letter_words

SELECT

FROM `malloy-data.malloytest.words` as words
WHERE (length(words.word))=5

Notice that there are a bunch of proper names? Let's look for only lowercase words as input and Uppercase words in the output of our query.

explore: words is table('malloy-data.malloytest.words'){
  query: five_letter_words is {
    where: length(word) = 5 and  word ~ r'^[a-z]{5}$'
    project: word is UPPER(word)
  }
}

and the query:

SELECT 
   UPPER(words.word) as word
FROM `malloy-data.malloytest.words` as words
WHERE ((length(words.word))=5)and(REGEXP_CONTAINS(words.word,r'^[a-z]{5}$'))

Searching for Words

Regular expressions are great for matching words. We are going to use a few patterns.

This letter exists somewhere in the word

Find words that contain X AND Y.

query: words->five_letter_words->{
  where: word ~ r'[X]' & ~ r'[Y]'
  project: word
}
QUERY RESULTS
word
PROXY
SIXTY 
[
  {
    "word": "PROXY"
  },
  {
    "word": "SIXTY"
  }
]
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     UPPER(words.word) as word
  FROM `malloy-data.malloytest.words` as words
  WHERE ((length(words.word))=5)and(REGEXP_CONTAINS(words.word,r'^[a-z]{5}$'))
)
SELECT 
   base.word as word
FROM `__stage0` as base
WHERE (REGEXP_CONTAINS(base.word,r'[X]'))and(REGEXP_CONTAINS(base.word,r'[Y]'))

Letter position: This letter here, that letter NOT there

Find words that have M in the 4th position and the 5th position is NOT E or Z

query: words->five_letter_words->{
  where: word ~ r'...M[^EZ]'
  project: word
}
QUERY RESULTS

WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     UPPER(words.word) as word
  FROM `malloy-data.malloytest.words` as words
  WHERE ((length(words.word))=5)and(REGEXP_CONTAINS(words.word,r'^[a-z]{5}$'))
)
SELECT 
   base.word as word
FROM `__stage0` as base
WHERE REGEXP_CONTAINS(base.word,r'...M[^EZ]')

Ruling letters out

Find words that do NOT contain S,L,O,P, or E

query: words->five_letter_words->{
  where: word !~ r'[SLOPE]'
  project: word
}
QUERY RESULTS

WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     UPPER(words.word) as word
  FROM `malloy-data.malloytest.words` as words
  WHERE ((length(words.word))=5)and(REGEXP_CONTAINS(words.word,r'^[a-z]{5}$'))
)
SELECT 
   base.word as word
FROM `__stage0` as base
WHERE IFNULL(NOT(REGEXP_CONTAINS(base.word,r'[SLOPE]')),FALSE)
